title: Biden Administration Outlines New Moves to Alleviate Supply-Chain Logjams at Ports
sub_head: The Port of Savannah, Ga., will be able to reallocate more than $8 million of funding after dozens of ships have backed up off the port
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”Ports snarled with supply-chain problems, including a major one in Georgia, will be able to redirect money from other federally funded projects to help ease the logjams under a plan outlined by the Biden administration.
The existing grant money could be used more quickly under the new policy, administration officials said Tuesday. They also highlighted $17 billion for ports and waterways that will be available after President Biden signs the roughly $1 trillion infrastructure spending package Congress approved last week.
